title: Elon Musk Gets a Crash Course in How Trumpworld Works

title_detail.value: Elon Musk Gets a Crash Course in How Trumpworld Works

summary: The world’s richest person, not known for his humility, is still learning the cutthroat courtier politics of Donald Trump’s inner circle — and his ultimate influence remains an open question.

summary_detail.value: The world’s richest person, not known for his humility, is still learning the cutthroat courtier politics of Donald Trump’s inner circle — and his ultimate influence remains an open question.

author: Theodore Schleifer
generated_summary: Elon Musk is navigating the intricate dynamics of Donald Trump's inner circle during the presidential transition. Despite not being a long-time ally or friend of Trump, Musk has gained influence through his significant social media following and financial support, including a $200 million contribution to Trump's campaign. Musk's recent activities include accompanying Trump to various events and a SpaceX launch, showcasing his efforts to align with Trump's team. Speculation surrounds how long Musk's relationship with Trump will last, as it requires balancing visibility and strategic maneuvering within the competitive environment of "Trumpworld." Musk's role includes potential leadership in a new Department of Government Efficiency, reflecting Trump's admiration for Musk's business acumen.

title: Electric shock: carmakers battle strict UK electric car rules as big fines loom

title_detail.value: Electric shock: carmakers battle strict UK electric car rules as big fines loom

summary: As Ford announced cutting 800 UK jobs it said rules forcing companies to sell more EVs each year are ‘unworkable’

summary_detail.value: As Ford announced cutting 800 UK jobs it said rules forcing companies to sell more EVs each year are ‘unworkable’

author: Jasper Jolly
generated_summary: UK carmakers, including Ford, are challenging the strict zero-emission vehicle (ZEV) mandate that requires a rising percentage of electric vehicle (EV) sales, due to a lack of expected demand for fully electric cars and increased sales of hybrids. Ford, which once supported the policy, now calls it "unworkable" and has announced 800 job cuts in the UK. The mandate targets 22% EV sales in 2024, rising to 28% by 2025, with fines for non-compliance. The industry faces challenges from the high upfront costs of EVs, insufficient public charging infrastructure, and opposition to net-zero policies. Despite the lobbying for more flexible rules, the UK government remains focused on climate goals, with some departments more open to adjustments than others. There is concern that strict mandates could threaten jobs and investments, while charger companies and environmental groups advocate for maintaining the targets.

title: Jeff Bezos’ $500 million superyacht spotted sailing for the first time in a spectacle everyone was waiting for

title_detail.value: Jeff Bezos’ $500 million superyacht spotted sailing for the first time in a spectacle everyone was waiting for

summary: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma - Known as Koru, it's one of the world’s most prestigious superyachts

summary_detail.value: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma - Known as Koru, it's one of the world’s most prestigious superyachts

author: @NalinRawat
generated_summary: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht, Koru, has been spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma, Mallorca. This three-masted sailing yacht, built by Oceanco in the Netherlands, is one of the world's most prestigious and was the second-largest of its kind when commissioned. The yacht, accompanied by a $75 million support vessel named Abeona, costs approximately $35 million annually to maintain. While it's unclear if Bezos or his partner Lauren Sanchez are onboard during this voyage, the yacht's presence may be for routine equipment trials. Koru previously visited Palma two years ago during its maiden voyage, with Bezos and Sanchez arriving by private jet and helicopter.

title: Nissan warns of emergency as car brands scramble to meet electric car targets or risk 'irreversible impact'

title_detail.value: Nissan warns of emergency as car brands scramble to meet electric car targets or risk 'irreversible impact'

author: Felix Reeves
generated_summary: Nissan has issued an urgent warning to the UK Government to revise the Zero Emission Vehicle (ZEV) mandate, as current targets threaten the UK automotive sector. The Japanese automaker, which operates the largest car manufacturing plant in Sunderland, highlighted that electric vehicle sales are lagging behind the mandate's ambitious goals. The Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) projects EV sales to reach only 18.5% of the market this year, short of the 22% target for 2024. The targets are set to rise to 28% in 2025 and eventually to 100% by 2035. Failure to meet these could result in substantial penalties for manufacturers, potentially costing £15,000 per non-compliant vehicle. Nissan argues that this could lead to manufacturers buying credits from foreign EV-only brands, effectively subsidizing other countries' sectors. To address this, Nissan proposes allowing more flexibility in credit borrowing and a two-year monitoring period to avert fines. Nissan's commitment to UK manufacturing is significant, with over 7,000 employees and investments in new EV production as part of its EV36Zero initiative. The company stresses the urgent need for government action to prevent an irreversible impact on the industry.

author: https://www.timeslive.co.za/authors/denis-droppa/
generated_summary: BMW has updated its F 900 XR sports tourer motorcycle, reducing its weight by 3kg. This weight reduction is achieved through new wheels that are 1.8kg lighter and a lighter battery. The XR series is known for combining sporty performance with touring capabilities, with the first model in the series being the S 1000 XR, which features a detuned version of the engine from BMW's S 1000 RR superbike. This update is part of BMW Motorrad's ongoing efforts to enhance the performance and efficiency of its motorcycle lineup.

title: How electric car apathy brought down Europe’s battery giant

title_detail.value: How electric car apathy brought down Europe’s battery giant

summary: If Northvolt cannot be revived, the bloc will be perilously exposed to China

summary_detail.value: If Northvolt cannot be revived, the bloc will be perilously exposed to China

author: Matthew Field
generated_summary: Northvolt, a prominent European battery manufacturer, has filed for bankruptcy protection in a New York court due to a severe cash crisis, despite raising over $15 billion from various investors since its inception in 2016. The company, which operates a major gigafactory in Skellefteå, Sweden, has been hit hard by declining demand for electric vehicles (EVs) in Europe and increased competition from cheaper Chinese alternatives. This downturn has led to reduced investments from major clients like BMW and the withdrawal of planned government funding. Northvolt's debts have reached nearly $6 billion, and it has already shut down several divisions. Founder and CEO Peter Carlsson has resigned, taking responsibility for the company's over-ambitious expansion plans. The company is now seeking a fresh capital injection of $1 billion to $1.2 billion to avoid being sold for parts. The situation highlights Europe's vulnerability in the battery supply chain, with experts warning of increased reliance on China if Northvolt cannot recover.

title: EU battery hopes in tatters as Northvolt CEO resigns and company files for bankruptcy

title_detail.value: EU battery hopes in tatters as Northvolt CEO resigns and company files for bankruptcy

summary: The company ran into big problems with production at a time when demand for EVs slumped.

summary_detail.value: The company ran into big problems with production at a time when demand for EVs slumped.

author: Jordyn Dahl
generated_summary: Northvolt, a prominent European battery manufacturer, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the U.S. and its CEO, Peter Carlsson, has resigned. The company, which aimed to be a leading player in Europe's battery industry, faced significant challenges including production issues, overspending, and a slowdown in electric vehicle demand. Northvolt's financial troubles were exacerbated by canceled contracts, such as a €2 billion deal with BMW, and financial struggles faced by its top investor, Volkswagen. Despite these setbacks, the company plans to continue operations at its key facilities in Sweden, Germany, and North America, and is seeking $1 to $1.2 billion in new funding to stabilize its finances. The Swedish government has declined to intervene, while German officials are unable to assist due to their own economic challenges. Northvolt's situation highlights the difficulties Europe faces in establishing a competitive battery industry amidst global competition, particularly from China.

title: Kia EV6 GT gets even more power plus trick gearbox from Hyundai Ioniq 5 N

title_detail.value: Kia EV6 GT gets even more power plus trick gearbox from Hyundai Ioniq 5 N

summary: Already Kia’s most powerful car, the EV6 GT will now produce up to 641bhp and 770Nm of torque

summary_detail.value: Already Kia’s most powerful car, the EV6 GT will now produce up to 641bhp and 770Nm of torque

author: Ellis Hyde
generated_summary: The Kia EV6 GT is set to receive a power boost and new features as part of a mid-life update. The car's maximum power output will increase from 577bhp to 641bhp, with torque rising to 770Nm when in 'GT' mode. This upgrade is expected to improve its 0-62mph acceleration time, potentially matching the Hyundai Ioniq 5 N's 3.4 seconds. The EV6 GT will also incorporate a 'Virtual Gear Shift' from the Ioniq 5 N, simulating gear changes to enhance the driving experience. A synthesised engine soundtrack will accompany this feature, although both can be disabled for a traditional electric car feel. Unlike the Ioniq 5 N, the EV6 GT will not have stiffer suspension, maintaining a softer ride. It will utilize an 84kWh battery, potentially enhancing its range from the previous 263 miles. Styling updates include new daytime running lights and a revised front end, along with interior enhancements like a new steering wheel and updated infotainment system. The updated model is expected to be available in 2025.

title: Trump’s anti-EV agenda could boost Chinese car industry

title_detail.value: Trump’s anti-EV agenda could boost Chinese car industry

summary: Ford CEO Jim Farley has said Chinese electric vehicles represent an “existential threat” to U.S. automakers.

summary_detail.value: Ford CEO Jim Farley has said Chinese electric vehicles represent an “existential threat” to U.S. automakers.

author: Mike Lee, Hannah Northey
generated_summary: Former President Donald Trump's plans to roll back support for electric vehicles (EVs) could inadvertently benefit Chinese car manufacturers, according to analysts. Trump has expressed intentions to reverse regulations set by the Biden administration that encourage domestic EV production and supply chains. This includes potential repeals of tax credits from the Inflation Reduction Act and increased tariffs on Chinese vehicles and components. Such actions might hinder U.S. automakers' ability to compete globally, despite the persistent international demand for EVs. Ford CEO Jim Farley has described Chinese EVs as an "existential threat" to U.S. manufacturers, highlighting the potential impact of Trump's policies on the American automotive industry.

title: Tiger Sport 660: Safety Update And New Colours

title_detail.value: Tiger Sport 660: Safety Update And New Colours

summary: Discover the updated Triumph Tiger Sport 660, featuring an IMU for improved safety and fresh colour choices.

summary_detail.value: Discover the updated Triumph Tiger Sport 660, featuring an IMU for improved safety and fresh colour choices.

author: Adithya Prasad
generated_summary: Triumph has updated the Tiger Sport 660 with significant enhancements in safety and style. The motorcycle now features an Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) that improves traction control and ABS for safer cornering. It also includes a bi-directional quick-shifter for clutchless gear changes and a standard connectivity system that pairs with smartphones via Bluetooth, displaying calls, texts, and navigation on a TFT screen. The Tiger Sport 660 retains its 660cc inline-three-cylinder engine, delivering 80bhp and 6.5kgm of torque, providing a smooth and powerful ride. Additionally, the bike is available in two new colors: Roulette Green and Crystal White.

title: Elon Musk has cozied into Trump’s White House. How long will this bromance last?

title_detail.value: Elon Musk has cozied into Trump’s White House. How long will this bromance last?

summary: The absurd Musk-Trump pact might have a silver lining: their relationship, like Trump’s coalition at large, is fragile

summary_detail.value: The absurd Musk-Trump pact might have a silver lining: their relationship, like Trump’s coalition at large, is fragile

author: Katrina vanden Heuvel
generated_summary: The article discusses the burgeoning relationship between Elon Musk and Donald Trump following Trump's re-election, highlighting Musk's increasing influence in the White House. Despite initial tensions, Musk has become a significant figure in Trump's administration, advising on appointments and policies. This alliance raises concerns about potential conflicts of interest, as Musk's companies benefit from public contracts while facing federal investigations. Musk's role in the newly formed Department of Government Efficiency, which aims to reduce government spending and regulation, is critiqued as largely symbolic. The partnership is seen as fragile, with analysts skeptical about its longevity due to the personalities involved. The article suggests that while Musk's influence is substantial, the non-binding nature of his recommendations limits their impact.

title: 'Pothole get-out-of-jail card being used by councils'

title_detail.value: 'Pothole get-out-of-jail card being used by councils'

summary: New analysis has revealed Gloucestershire has lowest rate of successful pothole damage claims.

summary_detail.value: New analysis has revealed Gloucestershire has lowest rate of successful pothole damage claims.

author: @BBCNews
generated_summary: A recent analysis reveals that only 2% of pothole damage claims against Gloucestershire County Council are successful, the lowest rate among 18 local authorities surveyed. In contrast, other councils pay out on an average of 20% of claims. Gloucestershire County Council attributes this to their robust system of inspections and repairs, which they claim minimizes the need to use taxpayer funds for compensation. Simon Williams, the head of policy at the RAC, noted that councils often avoid compensation by claiming unawareness of potholes. The council is currently trialling new methods to improve road conditions, including the use of advanced repair machines and proactive repair teams. Despite these efforts, the council acknowledges that it's challenging to inspect and repair every pothole immediately, especially in winter.

title: Northvolt files for bankruptcy protection in blow to Europe’s EV ambitions

title_detail.value: Northvolt files for bankruptcy protection in blow to Europe’s EV ambitions

summary: Swedish maker of battery cells for electric vehicles says it has enough cash to support operations for only a week

summary_detail.value: Swedish maker of battery cells for electric vehicles says it has enough cash to support operations for only a week

author: Guardian staff reporter
generated_summary: Northvolt, a prominent Swedish electric vehicle (EV) battery startup, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S., leading to the resignation of its CEO, Peter Carlsson. The company, which aimed to rival dominant Asian battery manufacturers, has struggled with production issues and cash flow problems. Northvolt needs to raise between $1 billion and $1.2 billion to stabilize its business. Despite securing $100 million in new financing, the company only has enough cash to operate for about a week. The bankruptcy filing follows unsuccessful talks for rescue investments and a recent announcement to cut 1,600 jobs. Northvolt has faced criticism for trying to build multiple factories simultaneously and losing BMW as a major customer. The Swedish government and stakeholders like Scania continue to support Northvolt, hoping restructuring will revive its fortunes. The company plans to complete its restructuring by the first quarter of 2025, while competition from established Asian firms remains intense.

title: Britons face road carnage with drivers losing out massively on compensation claims - 'Tip of the iceberg'

title_detail.value: Britons face road carnage with drivers losing out massively on compensation claims - 'Tip of the iceberg'

author: Felix Reeves
generated_summary: Britons are facing significant challenges with pothole compensation claims as claims have more than doubled from 2022 to 2023, but councils are reluctant to pay out. Data from the RAC revealed that claims surged from 8,327 to 20,432, with Surrey and Hampshire witnessing the most significant increases. Despite this, only 15% of claims were compensated, with councils frequently citing a lack of prior knowledge under Section 58 of the Highways Act 1980 to reject claims. Some councils, like Gloucestershire and Hertfordshire, rejected nearly all claims based on this reasoning. The average compensation payout is £260, often insufficient to cover repair costs. Labour has pledged an additional £500 million in the budget to address potholes, aiming to repair one million more per year. The Department for Transport is also investing in road maintenance, emphasizing cost-efficient solutions for taxpayers.

title: Peter Carlsson steps aside as CEO of Northvolt

title_detail.value: Peter Carlsson steps aside as CEO of Northvolt

summary: Carlsson co-founded Northvolt with the mission to drive sustainable energy solutions through the creation of a pioneer in European battery production.

summary_detail.value: Carlsson co-founded Northvolt with the mission to drive sustainable energy solutions through the creation of a pioneer in European battery production.

author: northvolt.com
generated_summary: Peter Carlsson, co-founder of Northvolt, is stepping down as CEO as the company enters a new phase marked by a Chapter 11 reorganization. This move is designed to provide Northvolt with the financial means to focus on operational improvements, customer support, and long-term competitive positioning. Carlsson will continue to contribute as a Senior Advisor and Member of the Board. Northvolt, a leader in European battery production, is known for its innovative facilities in Sweden, Germany, and Canada. The leadership transition involves Pia Aaltonen-Forsell, Chief Financial Officer, and Matthias Arleth, Chief Operations Officer, who will guide the company alongside Scott Millar, Chief Restructuring Officer, while a new CEO is sought. This shift underscores Northvolt's commitment to sustainable growth and operational efficiency.

title: The new BMW F 900 R and F 900 XR: Technical and visual upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment for the dynamic roadster and long-distance sports bike in the mid-range segment.

title_detail.value: The new BMW F 900 R and F 900 XR: Technical and visual upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment for the dynamic roadster and long-distance sports bike in the mid-range segment.

summary: The new BMW F 900 R and F 900 XR: Technical and visual upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment for the dynamic roadster and long-distance sports bike in the mid-range segment.

summary_detail.value: The new BMW F 900 R and F 900 XR: Technical and visual upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment for the dynamic roadster and long-distance sports bike in the mid-range segment.

author: @bmwgroup
generated_summary: BMW Motorrad has unveiled the new BMW F 900 R and F 900 XR, featuring significant technical and visual upgrades, and enhanced standard equipment. These mid-range models are designed for both dynamic roadster and long-distance sports biking. Key improvements include fully adjustable upside-down forks, lighter wheels, and a 3 kg overall weight reduction. Both models are powered by a Euro 5+ compliant two-cylinder engine with 895 cc capacity, offering 105 bhp and a dynamic riding mode for enhanced performance. Safety features such as Dynamic Traction Control, engine drag torque control, BMW Motorrad ABS Pro, and Dynamic Brake Control are standard. The F 900 R has a sportier riding position, while the F 900 XR offers improved aerodynamics for better touring capability. Both models come with new lighter batteries, integrated turn indicator lights, and optional accessories like a sports silencer and lockable soft cases. Available in three color variants, these models cater to both experienced riders and newcomers.

title: Pilot for Bluebird's return to Coniston Water announced

title_detail.value: Pilot for Bluebird's return to Coniston Water announced

summary: Dave Warby, son of the late-water speed record holder Ken Warby, will be in the cockpit at Coniston.

summary_detail.value: Dave Warby, son of the late-water speed record holder Ken Warby, will be in the cockpit at Coniston.

author: bbc.com
generated_summary: Donald Campbell's restored hydroplane, Bluebird K7, will return to Coniston Water in 2026, piloted by Dave Warby, son of the late water speed world-record holder Ken Warby. The Bluebird, which was destroyed in a 1967 crash, has been rebuilt after being recovered from Coniston Water 34 years later. Following a legal dispute over ownership, the Ruskin Museum now holds the craft, and plans to refurbish its Orpheus jet engines. Dave Warby, who aims to break the water speed record with his own craft, Spirit of Australia II, expressed honor at piloting Bluebird, which inspired his father's records. His reserve pilot will be RAF Flt Lt David-John Gibbs.

author: ADVrider Staff
generated_summary: BMW has unveiled the 2025 F900 XR, featuring significant upgrades for enhanced safety and comfort. Key improvements include cornering-sensitive traction control, ABS, and an adaptive headlight that improves visibility at night. The bike also boasts a new, fully adjustable suspension system tailored to various riding styles and terrains. Engine specifications remain robust, with an 895cc capacity delivering 105 hp at 8,500 rpm and 68.6 ft-lbs of torque at 6,500 rpm. The F900 XR includes a wide array of accessories, such as an Akrapovic exhaust. Overall, the updates aim to make the F900 XR a more responsive and safer adventure motorcycle.

title: Tesla’s path in China clears as Musk courts both Trump and Xi

title_detail.value: Tesla’s path in China clears as Musk courts both Trump and Xi

summary: Billionaire CEO is well connected in the US and China, something that could smooth the road ahead for the electric vehicle maker amid a looming tariff war

summary_detail.value: Billionaire CEO is well connected in the US and China, something that could smooth the road ahead for the electric vehicle maker amid a looming tariff war

author: Amy Hawkins
generated_summary: Elon Musk's connections with both Donald Trump and Xi Jinping are crucial for Tesla's future in China amid escalating US-China trade tensions. Musk, who has endorsed Trump and donated significantly to his re-election campaign, has been appointed to lead a new advisory body under Trump's administration. His close ties with Chinese leaders, including a strong relationship with Premier Li Qiang and President Xi Jinping, have facilitated Tesla's significant investments in China, including a major factory in Shanghai. This factory, which benefits from favorable loans and tax rates, is pivotal for Tesla as it aligns with China's economic priorities in high-tech industries. Musk's influence may help mitigate the impact of Trump's proposed tariffs on Chinese imports, which could otherwise harm Tesla's operations. Analysts suggest Musk could negotiate exemptions for Tesla, highlighting his strategic importance in the ongoing geopolitical and economic dynamics between the US and China.

title: IONIQ 9: hyundai debuts its largest EV model with interiors like a 'furnished lounge'

title_detail.value: IONIQ 9: hyundai debuts its largest EV model with interiors like a 'furnished lounge'

author: kat barandy I designboom
generated_summary: Hyundai has unveiled its largest electric vehicle (EV) model, the IONIQ 9 Electric SUV, at the Goldstein House in Los Angeles. This three-row SUV, part of Hyundai's IONIQ lineup, features a spacious interior designed to resemble a 'furnished lounge,' accommodating up to seven passengers with 'Relaxation Seats' and a unique Universal Island 2.0 console. The IONIQ 9 emphasizes passenger comfort and social interaction with swiveling second-row seats. Its exterior showcases Hyundai's 'Aerosthetic' design language, offering a sleek, aerodynamic look with customizable color options. The SUV is powered by a 110.3 kWh lithium-ion battery, providing an estimated range of 620 kilometers (385 miles) and supporting 800V ultra-fast charging, reaching 80% charge in 24 minutes. Hyundai also highlights sustainability, using eco-friendly materials in the interior. The IONIQ 9 is set to hit the roads in 2025.
